task.title: Edit dashboard and reportlet data
task.shortdesc: You can change data settings at the dashboard or reportlet level. For example, you can change the report suite, locking the report suite, changing dates, applying segments, and so on. You can also personalize a dashboard by inserting your company's confidentiality statement, and include HTML, XML, Web API, and CSV data in customized reportlets.

p.b: To edit dashboard and reportlet data

step.cmd: Click View All Reports > Dashboards> dashboard name to open a dashboard.

chdesc.p: Click the menu in the Marketing Cloud header, then select a report suite.
In the reportlet, click the report suite name, then select a report suite from the Report Suite menu. .

choption.p: Apply a segment to a dashboard

chdesc.p: In the Marketing Cloud header, click Show Segments, then select a segment.

choption.p: Apply a segment to a reportlet

chdesc.p: In the dashboard, click Layout to edit a dashboard.
In the reportlet, click the report suite name, then select a value from the Segment field and click Update.

choption.p: Lock a report suite (prevents changing the report suite in a reportlet)

chrow.chdesc: In the reportlet, click the report suite name, then enable Lock Report Suite. Click Update.

chdesc.p: For a dashboard, click the calendar. (All the reportlets in the dashboard reflect the change.)
For a reportlet, click the date link, then configure the calendar.
Open a dashboard, then click More > Rename.

choption.p: Set the dashboard as a landing page

chdesc.p: In a dashboard, click More > Set As Landing Page.
In a dashboard, click More > Download.
In a dashboard, click More > Print.
In a dashboard, click Save As, then specify a name.
